intro: Woodiellantha, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a fig-like structure that ripens to a yellowish hue and is edible. Woodiellantha is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
